text: Play is often talked about as if it were a relief from serious learning. But for children play is serious learning. Play is really the work of childhood.

The act of creating for young children is about the process, not the outcome. Children need to explore, take risks, make their own choices. This is the richness of creativity. This is the groundwork for future problem solvers.
Play is the highest form of research.
Children need the freedom to appreciate the infinite resources of their hands, their eyes and their ears, the resources of forms, materials, sounds and colors.
The goal of early childhood education should be to activate the child's own natural desire to learn
We worry about what a child will become tomorrow, yet we forget that he is someone today.
Play is often talked about as if it was a relief from serious learning. But for children, play is the serious learning. Play is really the work of childhood
Time spent playing with children is never time wasted
Think of playtime as an innovation lab where tomorrow's civilization is being actively designed

Early Childhood Educators are more powerful than simply 'being good with children.' Their real power is the ability to remember what it feels like to be a brand new human, to appreciate the magic in discovery, and to want to share that with children in a fun, positive, meaningful and lasting way- all at the same moment
It takes a village to raise a child. This is true. But it also takes a village to be a human. To feel connected. To Thrive
